labels.analysis: The MCP Server "Miro Server" is designed to integrate AI assistants with Miro boards, enabling users to manage and manipulate board content through a standardized interface. The extensive list of available tools covers a broad spectrum of Miro board operations, including board creation, item manipulation (text, images, shapes, connectors, etc.), group management, tagging, member sharing, and enterprise-level functionalities like board classification, export jobs, and audit logs. This server enhances collaboration and productivity by allowing seamless interaction with Miro boards directly from AI tools.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "Collaboration & Productivity" was chosen because the server's core functionality revolves around managing and enhancing collaboration on Miro boards, a prominent use case for productivity tools. "Daily Productivity" was added as a secondary label due to the direct impact on task management and workflow efficiency. "File Management" was also included as a secondary label due to the extensive capabilities for handling and manipulating various types of items on Miro boards.

remote_server_response.error: unhandled errors in a TaskGroup (1 sub-exception)

server_info_crawled.name: Miro Server
server_info_crawled.author: @k-jarzyna/mcp-miro
server_info_crawled.overview: Integrate AI assistants with Miro boards to manage content seamlessly. Access and manipulate board items through a standardized interface, enhancing collaboration and productivity. Streamline your workflow by leveraging Miro's capabilities directly from your AI tools.

tools.name: list-boards
tools.description: Deploy Server Miro Server Claim Server @k-jarzyna/mcp-miro Try in Playground list-boards

tools.name: create-board
tools.description: Create a new Miro board with specified name and sharing policies

tools.description: Update an existing Miro board with new settings

tools.name: delete-board
tools.description: Delete a Miro board by its ID. Deleted boards go to Trash (on paid plans) and can be restored via UI within 90 days after deletion.

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@k-jarzyna/mcp-miro/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
